poem:
"Peppa, In the American Dawn"

In the amber morning, desiring
in infant tongue old sophistication,
but finding a pig-rooted discord.

Bratty Peppa squeals not in English esteem,
rather in the hum of American tantrums.
Such are the syllables of disappointment
painted on a colouring screen. 

An affront not to Englishness,
but to childhood, its unbothered joy
in the wide-open arms of dawn.
